node.title: How to get X and Y coordinates of every node outputted to .csv file
node.bodyText:
Hello! I am trying to get moose to output a .cvs file that I need for post processing in MATLAB. I am looking to create a .csv or .txt file that contains the X and Y coordinate of each node and the associated variable called etab0 for each time step. For example, if I had 4 nodes, the output file would be something like:
x   y   eta
1   1   .2
1   2   .4
2   1   .3
2   2    .6
and the next file containing the next data set from the next time step or:
time   x   y   eta
1       1   1   .2
1       1   2   .4
1       2   1   .3
1       2   2    .6
2       1   1   .2
2       1   2   .4
2       2   1   .3
2       2   2    .6
I see the NodalVariableValue Post Processor however it requires a specified node and I want all the nodes as my simulation is more the 4 nodes. Is there a "all" command for this? Thank you
Also: it doesn't need to be the exact format I just need the variable and the associated coordinates for all nodes. And I would also take just the variable associated with each node for each time step and I could write a function in excel/MATLAB to fill in the x and y location.
I could have sworn we already have an object for that, but I cannot find it now. You could write your own derived from NodalVariableVectorPostprocessor though.

Would that involve writing code in C++? I would also be fine with the just the variable being outputted for each node for each time step and I fill in the coordinate values. Is there possibly a post processor for that?
@dschwen I think you are thinking of the https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/vectorpostprocessors/NodalValueSampler.html?

@maxnezdyur Thank you so much. That is perfect; I also found a workaround where you upload all the files to ParaView, then use the "save data" button and select CSV, and that also creates a file with x & y cords with associated variables.

node.title: I try to run an input file from an example it shows the error in the picture, I want to ask what is the add_material means from the error.

node.bodyText:
Hello
You put a kernel in the [Materials] block
For future reference, text is best copy-pasted, not in a screenshot
Guillaume

Dear Guillaume,
Thank you  for the answer and suggestion. I will check and modify the files.
Best regards,
Xiao

Sounds good
Please let me know if it does not work still

node.title: how to use natural logarithm operator ('ln') in an expression of function?
node.bodyText: what is the syntax to use how to use natural logarithm operator ('ln') in an expression of function? let say example.. ln(x).

Hello
You mean an expression in a ParsedFunction?
You can check the fparser documentation, it s linked in the ParsedFunction moose documentation.
I would just do log(x)/log(10) and move on
Guillaume

node.title: Boundary condition type
node.bodyText:
Hi there,
Is there a way to get the variable values of the nodes in blue color in the attached picture and impose these values on the boundary nodes in red color for each side of cohesive zone model. Thank you

Hello
Yes there are a number of ways. Are the meshes stitched in your system or apart but close?
Guillaume

Hello,
I am using BreakMeshByBlockGenerator to create an interface.
I think I might have mis-understood. You want the red and blue nodes on both sides of the split, both sides being independent, to have the same values?
yes. both sides are independent, i want to impose the variable values of the blue nodes on the red nodes for each side seperately.
if the gradient is 0 that would do get you a flat slope from red to blue. The values would be almost the same
you could define a nodeset the blue and for the red nodes, then add a Constraint to force the equality

I am using mixed formulation, so i want to impose the gradient to be zero along with equating the nodes. this will be inside a cohesive zone model that i am trying to develop for a fault embedded in a poroelastodynamic medium. if there is an easier way either than using a constraint, it will be great. thank you

I am using explicit scheme so i cannot use the a constraint like EqualValueBoundaryConstraint. if i can extract the nodesets for both blue and red nodes, how can i equate the variable values for these two nodsets ?

I used ParsedSubdomainMeshGenerator to generate new block containing both the blue and red nodes then i used ParsedGenerateSideset to create a sideset containing the blue nodes only. Then, I used NearestNodeValueAux to save the values of the blue nodes in an auxiliary variable but at the nodal positions of the red nodes. Finally, I imposed the boundary condition using MatchedValueBC between the auxiliary variable and main variable. Thank you

ok that's pretty clever. Just a note that the contribution to the Jacobian  of the BC is likely not correct from the get go. But if you use PJFNK it does not matter as much as if you were using Newton's method

node.title: Building new Moose Action
node.bodyText:
Hi there,
I am trying to build a custom cohesive zone action called PoroCohesiveZoneAction for variables (fluid velocity, pressure) besides displacements and tractions in our farmsApp. Following the code in SolidMechanics, We register our action in farmsApp.C:
static void
associateSyntaxInner(Syntax & syntax, ActionFactory & /*action_factory*/)
{
registerSyntax("PoroCohesiveZoneAction", "Actions/*");
}

And in the input file, we call the action:
[Actions/PoroCohesiveZoneAction]
    [./czm_ik]
        boundary = 'Block0_Block1'
        strain = SMALL
        generate_output='traction_x traction_y jump_x jump_y jump_vel_x jump_vel_y pressure_plus pressure_minus normal_traction tangent_traction normal_jump tangent_jump'
    [../]
[]

However, MOOSE is unable to find the action, returns the error:
*** ERROR ***
/home/amr/projects/farms/examples/benchmark_tpv2052D/version1/tpv2052D_Poro.i:84.1: section '[Actions]' does not have an associated "Action".
 Common causes:
- you misspelled the Action/section name
- the app you are running does not support this Action/syntax
/home/amr/projects/farms/examples/benchmark_tpv2052D/version1/tpv2052D_Poro.i:84.1: section '[Actions/PoroCohesiveZoneAction]' does not have an associated "Action".
 Common causes:
- you misspelled the Action/section name
- the app you are running does not support this Action/syntax
/home/amr/projects/farms/examples/benchmark_tpv2052D/version1/tpv2052D_Poro.i:85.5: section '[Actions/PoroCohesiveZoneAction/czm_ik]' does not have an associated "Action".
 Common causes:
- you misspelled the Action/section name
- the app you are running does not support this Action/syntax

I appreciate your help. The MOOSE I used is not the most updated version, although I don't think this is the reason of the problem.
And a follow-up question is: how to link this custom cohesive zone to the original cohesive zone model, since we would like to solve displacements and tractions also.
I did that but nothing change, it still show the same error.
did you recompile after changing? I m asking because you replied very soon after my post that's it
yes. i recompiled then i tried to run the problem again. should i do also make clobberall ?

should not be necessary.
ok using your executable, use the --dump or --json followed by &> some_file_name.txt to examine all the registered syntax
try to find what PoroCohesiveZoneAction got registered to there
Sorry, I don't know how to use that --dump or --json followed by &> some_file_name.txt. Can you provide example command ? Thank you
your_executable-opt --dump &> dump_file.txt

It gave this error:
�[31m
*** ERROR ***
basic_string::_M_construct null not valid�[39m

Stack frames: 7

0: libMesh::print_trace(std::ostream&)
1: moose::internal::mooseErrorRaw(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >)
2: void mooseError<char const*>(char const*&&)
3: /home/amr/projects/moose/framework/libmoose-opt.so.0(+0x9686cf) [0x7fa8e20b86cf]
4: main
5: __libc_start_main
6: ./farms-opt(+0x33ef) [0x56390badf3ef]
application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 0
[unset]: write_line error; fd=-1 buf=:cmd=abort exitcode=1
:
system msg for write_line failure : Bad file descriptor

what should i do ?

I dont know about that one.
what about --json
I tried --json but it gave me the same error.

ugh this is unexpected.
what did you type exactly?
and if you build in moose/test can you perform a syntax dump with the moose_test executable?

node.title: Mesh error
node.bodyText:
I have stitched two meshes together from previous simulations. Below is how the mesh was generated in the previous simulation:
[Mesh]
  type = GeneratedMesh
  dim = 2
  nx = 150
  ny = 150
#  nz = 2
  xmin = 0
  xmax = 300
  ymin = 0
  ymax = 300
  zmin = 0
  zmax = 0
#  elem_type = QUAD4
[]

Below is how I stitched together:
[Mesh]
  [./fmg_left]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = my_kks_noload_110_out.e-s172
  []

  [./fmg_right]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = my_kks_noload_one8_out.e-s172
  []

  [./smg]
    type = StitchedMeshGenerator
    inputs = 'fmg_left fmg_right'
    clear_stitched_boundary_ids = true
    stitch_boundaries_pairs = 'right left'
  []
[]

And the .e file does not give anything meaningful when I want to view it. @dschwen @GiudGiud

[Mesh]
  [./fmg_left]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = my_kks_noload_110_out.e-s172
  []

  [./fmg_right]

    file = my_kks_noload_one8_out.e-s172

    type = StitchedMeshGenerator
    inputs = 'fmg_left fmg_right'
    clear_stitched_boundary_ids = true
    stitch_boundaries_pairs = 'right left'
  []
[]

these files come from adaptivity dont they?
if the left and right boundary are at different levels of refinement, they are not going to be stitchable properly on a node-to-node basis.
I suspect 'right' and 'left' do not align spatially at all either, since you get 0 stitched nodes.
you need to use a TransformMeshGenerator to make the two sidesets super-impose
Yes, they do come from an adaptive mesh.

I get this error message:
*** ERROR ***
A 'TransformMeshGenerator' is not a registered object.
If you are trying to find this object in a dynamically loaded library, make sure that
the library can be found either in your "Problem/library_path" parameter or in the
MOOSE_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable.

https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/TransformGenerator.html
please feel free to use the documentation :D

I am not getting any information close to my problem as I am trying to also stitch two meshes together. I do not know which one to transform, scale, or translate. The example input scripts are not helping
the two sidesets you are trying to stitch must overlap. You need to translate one if they do not currently overlap

I  get this error when I try to translate. Maybe I do not understand the translation well.
*** ERROR ***
Your MeshGenerator tree contains multiple possible generator outputs :
"translate_mesh and one or more of the following from an independent set: "fmg_left, fmg_righ
t"
Below is the input script:
[Mesh]
[./fmg_left]
type = FileMeshGenerator
file = my_kks_noload_110_out.e-s172
[]
[./fmg_right]
type = FileMeshGenerator
file = my_kks_noload_one8_out.e-s172
[]
[translate_mesh]
type = TransformGenerator
input = fmg_left
transform = translate
vector_value = '1 2 0'
[]
[]
This may be due to a missing dependency or may be intentional. Please either

check that all the mesh generators are connected as a tree and culminate in a single final
mesh. Having one wrong 'input=mg' parameter is the most common error
add additional dependencies to remove the ambiguity if you are using a user-built MeshGener
ator
if you intend to execute a subset of the defined generators (uncommon), select the final Me
shGenerator in the [Mesh] block with the "final_generator" parameter.

you need to have a tree with a single output for the mesh generators
Add the stitch mesh generator, this joins the two branches

I get the same error:
** ERROR ***
Your MeshGenerator tree contains multiple possible generator outputs :
"translate_mesh and one or more of the following from an independent set: "fmg_left, smg, translate_mesh"
This may be due to a missing dependency or may be intentional. Please either

check that all the mesh generators are connected as a tree and culminate in a single final mesh. Having one wrong 'input=mg' parameter is the most common error
add additional dependencies to remove the ambiguity if you are using a user-built MeshGenerator
if you intend to execute a subset of the defined generators (uncommon), select the final MeshGenerator in the [Mesh] block with the "final_generator" parameter.

input script:
[Mesh]
[./fmg_left]
type = FileMeshGenerator
file = my_kks_noload_110_out.e-s172
[]
[./fmg_right]
type = FileMeshGenerator
file = my_kks_noload_one8_out.e-s172
[]
[translate_mesh]
type = TransformGenerator
input = fmg_right
transform = translate
vector_value = '1 2 0'
[]
[./smg]
type = StitchedMeshGenerator
inputs = 'fmg_left fmg_right'
clear_stitched_boundary_ids = true
stitch_boundaries_pairs = 'right left'
[]
[]

do this
[./smg]
type = StitchedMeshGenerator
inputs = 'fmg_left translate_mesh'
clear_stitched_boundary_ids = true
stitch_boundaries_pairs = 'right left'
[]

there is also a parameter called prevent_boundary_overlaps in the stichedMeshGenerator
this will merge the boundaries with the same names if you use it with 'false' instead of the default.
keep in mind merging boundaries is usually not the right thing to do, but it will load in paraivew

node.title: Adding heat source and temperature dependent material properties with navier stokes
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I am trying to simulate fluid flow, based on the thesis attached. So far, I have managed to successfully get it working, however the next step is to add a volumetric heat source function which varies with time. The function is currently defined as a ParsedFunction.
I am using INSFV implementation and can provide more detail if needed. I was previously using the HeatSource Kernel when not using Navier Stokes, so want to know if there is an equivalent.
I tried using a portion of the NavierStokesFV module, however no luck...
My attempt:
[Modules]
    [NavierStokesFV]
        pin_pressure = true
        pinned_pressure_type = average-uo
        external_heat_source = volumetric_decay_func
        block = fuel_salt
        density = ${rho}
        dynamic_viscosity = ${mu}
       []
[]


If this is a trivial solve, the second part of my question pertains to using functions to alter material properties, such as density, with temperature which seemingly requires FunctorMaterial properties.
Happy to expand on this! Thank you in advance!
Thesis: Verification of the fluid dynamics modules of the Multiphysics simulation framework MOOSE
Link: https://www.diva-portal.org/smash/get/diva2:1652721/FULLTEXT01.pdf

Hi Jake
A heat source should be easy to add.
If you have a working Modules/NavierStokes action syntax, adding the external_heat_source is the correct thing to do.
One problem may be if you are trying to block restrict the definition of the source? (not apply heat over the whole domain).
In that case, you can still use a FVBodyForce FVKernel on the side to define this.
For material properties, you will want to use a GeneralFunctorFluidProps material.
Many of the fluid properties will work without extra work in NavierStokes.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/FluidProperties/index.html
Do you have a working input without a heat source right now?
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume,
Thank you for the reply, I wanted to give these things a go before getting back to you. I have (partially) succeeded in implementing these suggestions.
FYI I am not using the Navier Stokes module at this stage, and am instead using the respective FVKernels.

FVBodyForce was exactly what was needed for the implementation of a heat source in a specified block.
GeneralFunctorFluidProps was also what was required, where my fluid properties are now defined using TemperaturePressureFunctionFluidProperties.

My only follow up is due to confusion regarding the use of the functor properties given by GeneralFunctorFluidProps:
Currently this is my GeneralFunctorFluidProps block:
[fuel_salt]
    type = GeneralFunctorFluidProps
    block = fuel_salt
    fp = salt_fluid_properties

    pressure = pressure
    T_fluid = T
    characteristic_length = 0.2
    speed = velocity_xy

    force_define_density = true
[]

Which I believe is correct, as it has no issues being read in all my FVKernels, except one...
It does not work for FVHeatConductionTimeDerivative, where density_name is requested instead of rho, like the other FVKernels I am using for NS. I have tried simply defining an ADParsedMaterial which defines a new density, which should vary the same. However my follow up question is whether I can do this in a different way?
Hope that makes sense! Thank you for this advice!
Jake

Hello
For FVHeatConductionTimeDerivative you would be able to set: density_name = rho
except not, because that kernel uses regular material properties instead of functor material properties.
Why do you want to use that kernel? The (P)INSFVEnergyTimeDerivative are meant to be used with NSFV, for both fluid and solid time derivatives.
The reason for the distinction is actually the use of a different material property system
Another way (same as the ADParsedMaterial) is to use this converter between systems
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/MaterialFunctorConverter.html
that's if you really need to use that kernel
Guillaume

Hi!
The use of FVHeatConductionTimeDerivative is my mistake, I thought I had seen it in a INSFV example... Upon checking the example* , it seems not! I cannot see why I would need it at this stage.
Thank you for providing a clear and concise response. I will mark your first response as the answer.
Best regards,
Jake

modules/navier_stokes/test/tests/postprocessors/rayleigh/natural_convection.i

node.title: QuasiStaticSolidMechanicsPhysics error
node.bodyText:
I have an input file with this block which keeps giving this error:
/home/emmanuel324/projects/belson2/My_Project/kks_crystal_plasticity/crystal_plasticity_myown/test1/Crysp/Bicrystal_Test/bicrystal_test5/bicrystal_test5.i:206.3:
The following error occurred in the Action 'phase1' of type QuasiStaticSolidMechanicsPhysics.
No SolidMechanics/QuasiStatic action can be block unrestricted if more than one SolidMechanics/QuasiStatic action is specified.�[39m
Below is the part of the input script:
[Physics/SolidMechanics/QuasiStatic]
[phase1]
strain = FINITE
incremental = true
add_variables = true
generate_output = stress_zz
block = 0
base_name = copper
[]
[phase2]
strain = FINITE
incremental = true
add_variables = true
generate_output = stress_zz
block = 1
base_name = brass
[]
[]
@GiudGiud @dschwen

hello
Seems like a bug, they are both block-restricted. Do you mind sharing the whole input?
Guillaume

#This model uses crystal plasticity to simulate the deformation of a polycrystalline nickel-based super alloy in the z-direction
gamm_p = gamma prime precipitate treated as FCC crystal structure
gamma_dp = gamma double precipitate treated as BCC structure
coupled with phase field
[GlobalParams]
  displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
[]

[Mesh]
  [phase1]  
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 3
    elem_type = HEX8
  []
  [phase1_id] 
    type = SubdomainIDGenerator
    input = phase1
    subdomain_id = 0
  []
  
  [phase3]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 3
    zmax = 2
    zmin = 1
    elem_type = HEX8
  []
  [phase3_id]
    type = SubdomainIDGenerator
    input = phase3
    subdomain_id = 1
  []
  [sticher]
    type = StitchedMeshGenerator
    inputs = 'phase1_id phase3_id'
    stitch_boundaries_pairs = 'front back'
    prevent_boundary_ids_overlap = false
  []
[]

[Variables]
    # concentration
  [./c]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
  
    # order parameter 1
  [./eta1]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
  
    # order parameter 3
  [./eta3]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
      #initial_condition = 0.0
  [../]
  
    # phase concentration 1
  [./c1]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
      #initial_condition = 0.0
  [../]
  
    # phase concentration 3
  [./c3]
      order = FIRST
      family = LAGRANGE
      #initial_condition = 0.2000
  [../]
  
  [./disp_x]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
    block = 0
  [../]
  
  [./disp_y]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
    block = 0
  [../]
  
  [./disp_z]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
    block = 0
  [../]
  
[]

[Functions]
  [./ic_func_c]
    type = ParsedFunction
    expression = 0.5+0.01*(cos(1.05*x)*cos(1.1*y)+(cos(1.3*x)*cos(0.87*y))^2+cos(0.25*x-1.5*y)*cos(0.7*x-0.2*y))
  [../]
  [./bc_func]
    type = ParsedFunction
    expression = sin(alpha*pi*x)
    symbol_names = alpha
    symbol_values = 16
  [../]
  [./disp_func]
    type = ParsedFunction
    expression = 'if(t<50,6e-3*t,0.3)'
  [../]
  [./press_func]
    type = ParsedFunction
    expression = '1'
  [../]
[]

[ICs]
  [./eta1]
    variable = eta1
    type = RandomIC
    min = -0.1825
    max = 0.1825
    seed = 192
  [../]
  
  [./c]
    variable = c
    type = RandomIC
    min = 0.24375	
    max = 0.25625
    seed = 89	
  [../]
[]

[AuxVariables]
  [pk2]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []
  [fp_zz]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []
  [e_zz]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []
  [phase1_gss]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
    block = 0
  []
  [phase1_slip_increment]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
    block = 0
  []
  [phase2_gss]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
    block = 1
  []
  [phase2_slip_increment]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
    block = 1
  []
  [./Energy]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  [../]
  [./stress_xx]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
    block = 0
  [../]
  [./e_xx]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  [../]
  [./bounds_dummy]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
[]




[Bounds]
  [./eta_upper_bound]
    type = ConstantBounds
    variable = bounds_dummy
    bounded_variable = eta1
    bound_type = upper
    bound_value = 1
  [../]
  [./eta_lower_bound]
    type = ConstantBounds
    variable = bounds_dummy
    bounded_variable = eta1
    bound_type = lower
    bound_value = -1
  [../]
[]



[AuxKernels]
  [pk2]
    type = RankTwoAux
    variable = pk2
    rank_two_tensor = second_piola_kirchhoff_stress
    index_j = 2
    index_i = 2
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
  [fp_zz]
    type = RankTwoAux
    variable = fp_zz
    rank_two_tensor = plastic_deformation_gradient
    index_j = 2
    index_i = 2
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
  [e_zz]
    type = RankTwoAux
    variable = e_zz
    rank_two_tensor = total_lagrangian_strain
    index_j = 2
    index_i = 2
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
  [gss_phase1]
    type = MaterialStdVectorAux
    variable = phase1_gss
    property = phsae1_slip_resistance
    index = 0
    block = 0
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
  [slip_inc_phase1]
    type = MaterialStdVectorAux
    variable = phase1_slip_increment
    property = phase1_slip_increment
    index = 0
    block = 0
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
  [gss_phase2]
    type = MaterialStdVectorAux
    variable = phsae2_gss
    property = phase2_slip_resistance
    index = 0
    block = 1
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
  [slip_inc_phase2]
    type = MaterialStdVectorAux
    variable = phase2_slip_increment
    property = phase2_slip_increment
    index = 0
    block = 1
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
  [./Energy_total]
    type = KKSMultiFreeEnergy
    Fj_names = 'F1 F3'
    hj_names = 'h1  h3'
    gj_names = 'g1  g3'
    variable = Energy
    w = 1
    interfacial_vars =  'eta1   eta3'
    kappa_names =       'kappa  kappa'
  [../]
  [./stress_xx]
    type = RankTwoAux
    variable = stress_xx
    rank_two_tensor = stress
    index_j = 0
    index_i = 0
    execute_on = timestep_end
    block = 0
  [../]
[]

[BCs]
  [./u_right_pull]
    type = Pressure
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
    variable = disp_x
    boundary = right
    factor = 0
  [../]
  
  [./all]
    type =  NeumannBC
    variable = 'c'
    boundary = 'left right top bottom'
    value = 0
  [../]	
  

  [symmy]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_y
    boundary = bottom
    value = 0
  []
  [symmx]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_x
    boundary = left
    value = 0
  []
  [symmz]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_z
    boundary = back
    value = 0
  []
  [tdisp]
    type = FunctionDirichletBC
    variable = disp_z
    boundary = front
    function = '0.01*t'
  []
[]

[Materials]
    # simple toy free energies
  [./f1]
    type = DerivativeParsedMaterial
    property_name = fc_1
    coupled_variables = 'c1'
    expression = '100.0*(c1-0.888)^2'
  [../]
    # Elastic energy of the phase 1
  [./elastic_free_energy_1]
    type = ElasticEnergyMaterial
    base_name = phase1
    property_name = fe_1
    coupled_variables = ' '
  [../]
    # Total free energy of the phase 1
  [./Total_energy_1]
    type = DerivativeSumMaterial
    property_name = F1
    sum_materials = 'fc_1 fe_1'
    coupled_variables = 'c1'
  [../]
  
  
  [./f3]
    type = DerivativeParsedMaterial
    property_name = fc_3
    coupled_variables = 'c3'
    expression = '5.0*(c3-0.2)^2'
  [../]
  
    # Elastic energy of the phase 3
  [./elastic_free_energy_3]
    type = ElasticEnergyMaterial
    base_name = phase3
    property_name = fe_3
    coupled_variables = ' '
  [../]
    # Total free energy of the phase 3
  [./Total_energy_3]
    type = DerivativeSumMaterial
    property_name = F3
    sum_materials = 'fc_3 fe_3'
    coupled_variables= 'c3'
  [../]
  
    # Switching functions for each phase
    # h1(eta1, eta3)
  [./h1]
    type = SwitchingFunctionMultiPhaseMaterial
    phase_etas = eta1
    all_etas = 'eta1 eta3'
    h_name = h1
  [../]
  
    # h3(eta1, eta3)
  [./h3]
    type = SwitchingFunctionMultiPhaseMaterial
    phase_etas = eta3
    all_etas = 'eta1 eta3'
    h_name = h3
  [../]
  
    # Coefficients for diffusion equation
  [./Dh1]
    type = DerivativeParsedMaterial
    material_property_names = 'D h1'
    expression = D*h1
    property_name = Dh1
  [../]
  
  [./Dh3]
    type = DerivativeParsedMaterial
    material_property_names = 'D h3'
    expression = D*h3
    property_name = Dh3
  [../]
  
    # Barrier functions for each phase
  [./g1]
    type = BarrierFunctionMaterial
    g_order = SIMPLE
    eta = eta1
    function_name = g1
  [../]
  
  [./g3]
    type = BarrierFunctionMaterial
    g_order = SIMPLE
    eta = eta3
    function_name = g3
  [../]
  
    # constant properties
  [./constants]
    type = GenericConstantMaterial
    prop_names  = 'L    kappa  D  misfit  W'
    prop_values = '0.3  0.01   1  0.005  0.01'
  [../]
  
  [elasticity_tensor_phase1]
    type = ComputeElasticityTensorCP
    C_ijkl = '1982 534 496 1606 605 1788 985 1056 388'
    fill_method = symmetric9
    base_name = phase_1
    block = 0
  []
  [stress_phase1]
    type = ComputeMultipleCrystalPlasticityStress
    crystal_plasticity_models = 'trial_xtalpl_phase1'
    tan_mod_type = exact
    base_name = phase1
    block = 0
  []
  [trial_xtalpl_phase1]
    type = CrystalPlasticityKalidindiUpdate
    number_slip_systems = 12
    slip_sys_file_name = input_slip_sys.txt
    base_name = phase1
    block = 0
  []
  [elasticity_tensor_phase3]
    type = ComputeElasticityTensorCP
    C_ijkl = '2008.5 448.9 918.5 2008.5 918.5 1538.7 779.8 779.8 309.9'
    fill_method = symmetric9
    euler_angle_1 = 0.0
    euler_angle_2 = 45.0
    euler_angle_3 = 0.9
    base_name = phase3
    block = 1
  []
  [stress_phase3]
    type = ComputeMultipleCrystalPlasticityStress
    crystal_plasticity_models = 'trial_xtalpl_phase3'
    tan_mod_type = exact
    base_name = phase3
    block = 1
  []
  [trial_xtalpl_phase3]
    type = CrystalPlasticityKalidindiUpdate
    number_slip_systems = 48
    slip_sys_file_name = input_slip_sys_bcc48.txt
    base_name = phase3
    block = 1
  []
  
  [./strain_phase1]
    type = ComputeSmallStrain
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
    base_name = phase1
    eigenstrain_names = eigenstrain1
  [../]
  
  [./strain_phase3]
    type = ComputeSmallStrain
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
    base_name = phase3
  [../]
  
  [./eigen_strain1]
    type = ComputeEigenstrain
    base_name = phase1
    eigen_base = '1 0 0 0 0 0'
    prefactor = misfit
    eigenstrain_name = eigenstrain1
  [../]
  
   # Generate the global stress from the phase stresses
  [./global_stress]
    type = MultiPhaseStressMaterial
    phase_base = 'phase1  phase3'
    h          = 'h1        h3'
  [../]
  
  [./global_strain]
    type = ComputeSmallStrain
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
  [../]
  
[]

[Kernels]
  [./TensorMechanics]
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
    incremental = true
  [../]
  
    #Kernels for diffusion equation
  [./diff_time]
    type = TimeDerivative
    variable = c
  [../]
  [./diff_c1]
    type = MatDiffusion
    variable = c
    diffusivity = Dh1
    v = c1
  [../]
  
  [./diff_c3]
    type = MatDiffusion
    variable = c
    diffusivity = Dh3
    v = c3
  [../]
  
    # Kernels for Allen-Cahn equation for eta1
  [./deta1dt]
    type = TimeDerivative
    variable = eta1
  [../]
  [./ACBulkF1]
    type = KKSMultiACBulkF
    variable  = eta1
    Fj_names  = 'F1 F3'
    hj_names  = 'h1 h3'
    gi_name   = g1
    eta_i     = eta1
    wi        = 0.01
    coupled_variables      = 'c1 c3 eta3'
  [../]
  [./ACBulkC1]
    type = KKSMultiACBulkC
    variable  = eta1
    Fj_names  = 'F1 F3'
    hj_names  = 'h1  h3'
    cj_names  = 'c1  c3'
    eta_i     = eta1
    coupled_variables      = 'eta3'
  [../]
  [./ACInterface1]
    type = ACInterface
    variable = eta1
    kappa_name = kappa
  [../]
  
  
    # Kernels for constraint equation eta1 + eta3 = 1
    # eta3 is the nonlinear variable for the constraint equation
  [./eta3reaction]
    type = MatReaction
    variable = eta3
    mob_name = 1
  [../]
  [./eta1reaction]
    type = MatReaction
    variable = eta3
    v = eta1
    mob_name = 1
  [../]
  
  [./one]
    type = BodyForce
    variable = eta3
    value = -1.0
  [../]
  
  
    #Phase concentration constraints
  [./chempot13]
    type = KKSPhaseChemicalPotential
    variable = c1
    cb       = c3
    fa_name  = F1
    fb_name  = F3
  [../]
  
  [./phaseconcentration]
    type = KKSMultiPhaseConcentration
    variable = c3
    cj = 'c1  c3'
    hj_names = 'h1  h3'
    etas = 'eta1  eta3'
    c = c
  [../]
[]


[Physics/SolidMechanics/QuasiStatic]
  [./phase1]
    strain = FINITE
    incremental = true
    add_variables = true
    generate_output = stress_zz
    block = 0
    base_name = phase1
  [../]
  [phase2]
    strain = FINITE
    incremental = true
    add_variables = true
    generate_output = stress_zz
    block = 1
    base_name = phase2
  []
[..]
[Postprocessors]
  [phase1_stress_zz]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = phase1_stress_zz
    block = 0
  []
  [gamma_dp_stress_zz]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = phase1_stress_zz
    block = 1
  []
  [pk2]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = pk2
  []
  [fp_zz]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = fp_zz
  []
  [e_zz]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = e_zz
  []
  [phase1_gss]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = phase1_gss
    block = 0
  []
  [phase1_slip_increment]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = phase1_slip_increment
    block = 0
  []
  [phase2_gss]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = phase2_gss
    block = 1
  []
  [phase2_slip_increment]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = phase2_slip_increment
    block = 1
  []
  [./dofs]
    type = NumDOFs
  [../]
  [./h1_error]
    type = ElementH1Error
    variable = eta1
    function = bc_func
  [../]
[]

[Preconditioning]
  [smp]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  solve_type = 'PJFNK'

  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_asm_overlap -sub_pc_type -ksp_type -ksp_gmres_restart'
  petsc_options_value = ' asm      2              lu            gmres     200'
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-10
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-10
  nl_abs_step_tol = 1e-10
  
  end_time = 5000

   [./TimeStepper]
     type = IterationAdaptiveDT
     dt = 5e-4
     cutback_factor = 0.75
     growth_factor = 1.2
     optimal_iterations = 20
   [../]
[]

[Preconditioning]
    active = 'full'
  [./full]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  [../]
  [./mydebug]
    type = FDP
    full = true
  [../]
[]



[Outputs]
  exodus = true
    print_linear_residuals = true
  [./table]
    type = CSV
    execute_on = timestep_end
  [../]
  [./checkpoint]
    type = Checkpoint
    num_files = 10
    interval = 10
  [../]
[]

[Debug]
    show_var_residual_norms = true
[]

this should not be here
[Kernels]
  [./TensorMechanics]
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
    incremental = true
  [../]

this is the non-block restricted one

node.title: Transient solve; steady-state detection on postprocessor output
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I am wondering if it is possible to specify a specific quantity to base the steady-state detection on when steady_state_detection = true? I see there is a check_aux option, but this is a bool and so not useful for pointing to a specific aux variable.
I want to stop the simulation when the change in the maximum temperature is steady (not interested in other dynamics).
So I am looking for something similar to this:
[Postprocessors]
  [max-temp]
    type = NodalExtremeValue
    variable = temp
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  steady_state_detection = true
  steady_state_monitor = max-temp # Does something like this exist?
[]

I am looking to do some UQ on a big transient simulation, so I am trying to find performance savings to minimise excess computation.
Best,
Josh

Hello
You cannot do this with the executioner parameters currently. You will soon be able to do thanks to development of a new Convergence system that will have many options.
For now,use a terminator user object to finish the simulation and a postprocessor to measure the criterion (change in the variable)
Guillaume
Thanks, I just checked Terminator. It looks like exactly what I need!
